agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Business & Commerce TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 4, 2019 PLACE: E1.016 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Kelly Hancock To be considered: SB 437 Nelson Relating to prohibited practices by a life insurance company relating to an individual's prescription for or obtainment of an opioid antagonist. SB 446 West Relating to requiring a public employer to give notice to new employees of the ability of certain employees to participate in the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. SB 808 Nichols Relating to the construction manager-at-risk method of contracting for governmental construction projects. SB 1100 Buckingham Relating to electricity service provided by certain municipally owned utilities. SB 1185 Creighton Relating to the towing of certain property from a self-service storage facility for disposition by a vehicle storage facility. SB 1336 Zaffirini Relating to the workers' compensation classification system and rate filings. SB 1415 Hancock Relating to the ownership, control, or operation of a franchised or nonfranchised dealer or dealership by certain motor vehicle manufacturers and distributors. SB 1529 Perry | et al. Relating to merger agreements among certain hospitals; imposing fees. SB 1739 Menéndez Relating to payment for care provided by a chiropractor under certain health benefit plans. SB 1852 Paxton Relating to disclosures required in connection with the issuance of certain health benefit plans. SB 1853 Paxton Relating to certain workers' compensation reporting requirements. SB 1940 Hancock Relating to the administration of a temporary health insurance risk pool. SB 2036 Hall Relating to the authority of a commodity producers board or a committee to hold meetings by telephone conference. SB 2333 Creighton Relating to the operation of the Texas Title Insurance Guaranty Association. SB 2409 Menéndez Relating to the Internet domain name used by a website that sells tickets to events. Pending Business Public testimony will be limited to 3 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name and bill number on each copy. You may register for this hearing using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways or by going to http://swrs. Bills added after last posting: SB 1852 SB 1853 Bills deleted after last posting: SB 1549 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
